channel.title: Something to program
channel.description:
Ok, I love programming, I've been trying to think of something to program lately..and I honestly can't think of anything.
I keep thinking and thinking and the only thing I can think of is trying to make a Runescape bot, but that's completely out of the question seeing as how I don't honestly give a shit about runescape....so basically this thread is me begging someone to help me think of something to make. I don't honestly care what it is, just please don't make it something insanely difficult.

item.title: Something to program
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

make a program which parses this website http://www.randominsults.net/
then heavily optimise it, see how quick you can get it.

once you’ve done that, spam out the phrases in runescape

item.title: Something to program
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:12, topic:172029”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=232145.msg1986748#msg1986748 date=1199863430]

[quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=232145.msg1986744#msg1986744 date=1199863258]
Hahaha, yeah. I never use Auto-GUI Tools or anything like that. I do it all in Notepad, except for the occasional GUI-Maker so I can get coordinates for where I want to put things faster.
[/quote]Ok, I don’t go as far as to use Notepad, I do use Netbeans for the IDE. I love the auto-complete feature, saves so much time when programming and the auto-indention is awesome too…and the Import handler stuff
[/quote]Eh I didn’t neccessarily mean NotePad, I just noticed lol. I meant just simple non-auto-GUI tools. I use NotePad a lot, but I’m going to switch over to a good IDE. NetBeans sounds good, I’ve tried it, and I dont like it too much. I was thinking maybe IntellJ Idea or whatever. If you have any suggestions, that’d be great. :)[/quote]My favorites are

IDEA
Eclipse
Netbeans

And for quick edits I use:

Notepad++
Textpad (Not so much anymore honestly)

Read full topic

I meant just simple non-auto-GUI tools. I use NotePad a lot, but I’m going to switch over to a good IDE. NetBeans sounds good, I’ve tried it, and I dont like it too much. I was thinking maybe IntellJ Idea or whatever. If you have any suggestions, that’d be great.

item.title: Something to program
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

That would also be great. If the PS3 ever comes out with Java-support (not sure if it does right now), then I can chat to my friends using the Internet Browser if its on the web.

EDIT: It would also be quite a challenge, figuring out how each protocol works, etc. It would be interesting and fun as well, and a worth-while challenge. If you do work on that, Evil_, include major services like AIM, YIM!, IRC, ICQ, MSN, gTALK, Xfire, Gadu-Gadu, and MyScape IM.

Read full topic

What about a Java-based multi-IM client?

Read full topic

item.title: Something to program
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Make a program where you select a Instant Messenger and it’ll receive all passwords and decrypt them, displaying the output for you to see incase you forgot something. These can also be sold for money, if you get them right.

As an extra touch, you can make an option to search the user’s system for any passwords on ANY Instant Messenger, decrypt, and display.

Although these are already out, if you make one good enough, it can be sold for real life cash.
Examples:
http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/mspass.html
http://www.rixler.com/instant_messengers_password_recovery.htm

TechSpot

Advanced Instant Messengers Password Recovery

Download Advanced Instant Messengers Password Recovery. Recover login and password information (stored locally) for most popular instant messengers.

The last link, in my opinion, is the best. And if you need a start, I made a Trillian Password Decrypter not too long ago:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Yeah, you’re probably thinking that this is pretty stupid. But, hey, its worth a shot. It’s definitely not the easiest project, but not the hardest in the world. It’ll involve looking in the System’s Registry and Decryption Methods which either you’ll have to figure out, or you will have to search for on Google, etc. A good challenge. Meh, you’ll probably laugh at me but whatever, it’s up to you.

If you dont want to do that, you can always make a tool that will personally benefit you. According to your profile, you are 16 years old. Try making a tool that will help you in your math classes. Geometery, Algebra I, Algebra II, Trig., etc. Something that will solve the equation/problem for you and show you step by step how it was done. This can help lots, especially if you’re stuck on a problem.

Well, that’s all I can think of for now. Sorry if it was lame or whatever, I dont care, just throwing out ideas I might work on sooner or later.

Read full topic
